wallet-encrypted: Your wallet is encrypted. Please enter the password
remove-wallet-desc: Be sure you have saved the private key and/or Keystore File and the password before you remove it. If you want to use this wallet with your MyEtherWallet CX in the future, you will need to manually re-add it using the private key/JSON and password..
are-you-sure-delete: Are you sure you want to delete wallet
how-would-you-add-wallet: How would you like to add your wallet?
mewcx-only: MEW CX is only available in these browsers
install-prompt: Please install the  MEW CX extension and refresh your page.
no-wallet-add: You don't have any wallet saved. Click and add Wallet to get started
by-entering-pw: By entering your password, you accept our
trying-to-access-mew: is trying to access MEW CX. Please choose a wallet that you want to connect.
web3-detected: We've detected other Web3 applications (a wallet browser extension, i.e. MetaMask) running in the background. In order for MEW CX to function properly, please make sure all other Web3 instances are closed.
generate-wallet-description: Generate your own unique Ethereum wallet. Receive a public address (0x...) and set a password for wallet encryption.
mnemonic-phrase-description: Add your wallet using a mnemonic phrase. Mnemonic phrases are 12-24 words in length, but sometimes they contain an extra word for added security.
private-key-description: Add your wallet using a private key. Private keys are 64 hexadecimal characters.
keystore-file-description: Add your wallet using a keystore file. A keystore file is your private key encrypted into a JSON file format.
